quiz.title: Graph to Equation Conversion
quiz.subtitle: Unit 5 Quiz 1: Writing Equations from Graphs
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Deriving Linear Equations from Graphical Representations

questions.question: Based on the graph shown, which equation represents the line?
questions.explanation: From the graph: line passes through (0, -2) and (2, 2). Slope = (2 - (-2))/(2 - 0) = 4/2 = 2. y-intercept = -2. So $y = 2x - 2$.

questions.question: What is the equation of the horizontal line shown in the graph?
questions.explanation: Horizontal lines have equation $y = \text{constant}$. The line crosses the y-axis at 3, so $y = 3$.

questions.question: The graph shows a line with negative slope. Which equation matches the graph?
questions.explanation: From graph points (1, 4) and (3, 0): Slope = (0 - 4)/(3 - 1) = -4/2 = -2. Using point-slope: $y - 4 = -2(x - 1) \Rightarrow y = -2x + 6$.

questions.question: Which equation represents the vertical line shown?
questions.explanation: Vertical lines have equation $x = \text{constant}$. The line crosses the x-axis at -4, so $x = -4$.

questions.question: From the graph shown, determine the equation of the line.
questions.explanation: Line passes through (0, -1) and (2, 0). Slope = (0 - (-1))/(2 - 0) = 1/2. y-intercept = -1. So $y = \frac{1}{2}x - 1$.

scoreMessages.80: Excellent! You can accurately extract slope and intercept from visual graphs.
scoreMessages.60: Good work. Practice identifying y-intercept from where line crosses y-axis and calculating precise slope using clear points.
scoreMessages.40: Focus on: 1) Finding exact intercepts, 2) Counting slope accurately using rise/run, 3) Distinguishing horizontal/vertical lines.
scoreMessages.0: Start with identifying y-intercept, then calculate slope using two clear points on the line.
